extendedInfo.description: Etherbooks is the new reading experience, connecting readers and writers around the world. Choose from Etherâs huge selection of high-quality free and paid Quick Reads: non-fiction, fiction, short stories, poems, articles, essays and blogs in genres from Sci-Fi & Fantasy to Romance to Erotica to Mind Body & Spirit. Our writers include Sir Paul McCartney, 2xMan Booker Prize Winner Hilary Mantel, Louis de BerniÃ¨res and thousands of exciting and talented up-and-coming writers from around the world. As we get to know you, Ether will recommend writers and Quick Reads that we know youâll love!Connect with your favourite writers and other readers. Send them direct messages, start discussions about your favourite Quick Reads, join our forums and even start your own book club!Share Ether books and your favourite writers and Quick Reads with your friends on the app or through Facebook and Twitter.Read offline and customize your reading settings to personalize your reading experience. Browse Etherbooksâ catalog of publications via Facebook or the web. You can âlikeâ Quick Reads and writers, access reviews and ratings, manage your collection and add Quick Reads to your wishlist so itâs all waiting for you when you next access the app. Become an Ether writer! Head to our website (www.etherbooks.com) and submit today! New writers and new stories published every day.Like us on Facebook (www.facebook.com/Etherbooks) and Follow Etherbooks on twitter (www.twitter.com/etherbooks). Join the global community, join the conversation.

reviews.title: Great program.
reviews.comment: Not why Sir Paul had to charge. Did he donate it to charity.maybe? Otherwise some interesting articles.
reviews.author: Michael O\'Brien

reviews.title: Perfect for the commute
reviews.comment: Lots of great original pieces of work of all genres.
reviews.author: Peter Hackshaw

reviews.title: Fab app for quick reads!
reviews.comment: The best there is for top notch quality speedy reads. Varied genres and some great authors including Hillary Mantel.
reviews.author: Penny Pepper

reviews.title: Fab app for fiction
reviews.comment: Easy, user friendly and accessible for connecting you with the best short story writers around the world.
reviews.author: Freya Sterling

reviews.title: Great App!
reviews.comment: Fun format, easy to use, can\'t wait for the upcoming content!
reviews.author: Matthew Kippen

reviews.title: Marvelous
reviews.comment: An excellent range of high quality content in a smooth functioning app
reviews.author: Lindsey Sheehan

reviews.title: Great reads
reviews.comment: Great place to find new writers and new content.
reviews.author: Mike Jones

reviews.title: Simple and so effective to access fast fiction
reviews.comment: Since I finally obtained a smart phone and down-loaded the Ether app I\'ve found accessing their fab range of short stories as easy as pie.
reviews.author: Jim Dunkley

reviews.title: Handy app for book lovers!
reviews.comment: Enjoy reading during your break, on a train, waiting for an appointment? Don\'t want to carry a book around with you? Then this app is just up your street and it\'s free and there are loads of free stories too. Great stuff :)
reviews.author: Bob Lock

reviews.title: Brilliant!
reviews.comment: So many amazing things to read and I can talk to the writers - too freaking cool.
reviews.author: Helen Fleming

reviews.title: Like reading - love this!
reviews.comment: A great looking reading app with lots of excellent stories. Being able to discuss stories with both friends and the writers themselves is like having a back-stage pass - really cool!
reviews.author: Neil van Raalte

reviews.title: Tingle tones on my phone
reviews.comment: The Ether Books phone app means I can satisfy my Erotica cravings wherever, and whenever, I want. Short and sweet vibrations . . . Or long tingling reads that make every bus journey fun and satisfying. Literally speaking, such a wonderful idea!
reviews.author: Modesty Ablaze

reviews.title: Didn\'t work
reviews.comment: This app wouldn\'t work. It just kept saying it was unable to log into my account. There were no options to look at settings, submit an error report or read an FAQ. Presumably these things require logging in first, which defeats the purpose.
reviews.author: Adam Lowe
